channel.title: Harddrives
channel.description: Well, I'm in the middle of making my old Dell Dimension into a webserver. Well, nothing has been going the way planned. I've been trying to install UNIX OS and Windows OS on the hard drive.. but no partitions at all have been found. So I think the hard drive is shot (Dell support said). I was wondering if any hard drive can fit into any computer.

item.title: Harddrives
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

Just going to shift this over to Questions, but more on topic, I wouldn’t advise using Norton Partition Magic, I’ve had trouble with that in the past.

Despite that, from the general things you’ve said, I’d recommend just buying a new drive since they are massively cheaper now.

Read full topic

item.title: Harddrives
item.dc:creator: @Payback_Is_A_Bitch Payback Is A Bitch
item.description:
@Payback_Is_A_Bitch wrote:

Also guys, I got Norton Partition Maker to install Linux onto the hdd and when I booted up the computer it said no bootable cartridge found.

Read full topic

item.title: Harddrives
item.dc:creator: @_bool
item.description:
@_bool wrote:

[quote=“davidude36, post:3, topic:221146”]Take into account what Mopman said and also try to use google a bit more. Learning about what partitioning is and how to do it is real easy.

Also there are two main types of hard drives that I know of and they are IDE(the one with a cable that is really flat and wide), or a SATA hard drive which has a smaller cable then IDE. I don’t know the main differences in them but I know that my motherboard supports both, and I am running both (80gb|750gb).[/quote]
SATA data transfer is faster.
IDE is slower.
Personally I only use SATA drives.

Read full topic

item.title: Harddrives
item.dc:creator: @Payback_Is_A_Bitch Payback Is A Bitch
item.description:
@Payback_Is_A_Bitch wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:2, topic:221146”]Uh, you can create partitions using a partitioning tool, or some installers, Ubuntus and Windows included, will do it for you, although Windows’ sucks.

Which UNIX are you using?[/quote]
Well, I don’t know how to create a partition even though I do have Norton Partition Maker and when I went to install Windows it said there wasn’t any partitions on the hard drive. Well, I made one big one on my computer im on now as the slave drive then took it and put it in the other computer and it said the same thing.

Read full topic

item.title: Harddrives
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

Take into account what Mopman said and also try to use google a bit more. Learning about what partitioning is and how to do it is real easy.

Also there are two main types of hard drives that I know of and they are IDE(the one with a cable that is really flat and wide), or a SATA hard drive which has a smaller cable then IDE. I don’t know the main differences in them but I know that my motherboard supports both, and I am running both (80gb|750gb).

Read full topic

item.title: Harddrives
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Uh, you can create partitions using a partitioning tool, or some installers, Ubuntus and Windows included, will do it for you, although Windows’ sucks.

Which UNIX are you using?

Read full topic
